dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4834 IH: Guarding and Administering Trespass Enforcement, Controlling Restricted Areas, and Stopping High-risk Encroachment Recidivism and Sabotage Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Arrington introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to establish a criminal penalty for unauthorized access to Department of Defense facilities.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Guarding and Administering Trespass Enforcement, Controlling Restricted Areas, and Stopping High-risk Encroachment Recidivism and Sabotage Act or the GATE CRASHERS Act.

section.header: Unauthorized access to Department of Defense facilities

subsection.text: Chapter 67 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Unauthorized access to Department of Defense facilities

subsection.text: It shall be unlawful, within the jurisdiction of the United States, without authorization to go upon any property that—

paragraph.text: is under the jurisdiction of the Department of Defense; and
has been clearly marked as closed or restricted.

subsection.text: Any person who violates subsection (a) shall—

paragraph.text: in the case of the first offense, be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 180 days, or both;
in the case of the second offense, be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 3 years, or both; and
in the case of the third or subsequent offense, be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 10 years, or both.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 67 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1390. Unauthorized access to Department of Defense facilities.
